flawed_nl_solution:
Jerry mows 8 acres x 3/4 = 6 acres with a riding mower.
It will take him 6 acres / 2 each hour = <<6/2=3>>3 hours.
Jerry mows 8 acres - 6 acres mowed with a riding mower = <<8-6=7>>7 acres with a push mower.
It will take him 7 acres x 1 hour = <<7*1=7>>7 hours.
It takes Jerry a total of 3 hours on the riding mower + 7 hours on the push mower = <<3+7=10>>10 hours.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 2, not 7. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
